required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Staging in the Placenta Accreta
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Ultrasound Staging System in Prediction of Morbidly Adherent Placenta

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators evaluated the efficacy of a staging system introduced by the American Institute of ultrasound in medicine 2015 including sonographic parameters associated with morbidly adherent placenta for antenatal prediction of placental invasion.

detailed_description.textblock: Morbidly adherent placenta (MAP) defines a spectrum of conditions, including placenta accreta, increta, and percreta, which are associated with significant maternal and fetal morbidity and mortality. Ultrasound evaluation, with grayscale, is the recommended first-line modality for diagnosing MAP. Grayscale ultrasound features suggestive of placenta accreta include the loss of myometrial interface or retroplacental clear space, reduced myometrial thickness and the presence of intraplacental lacunae. Using a staging system by antenatal ultrasound can predict placental invasion antenatally.

primary_outcome.measure: Confirmation of the stage of myometrial placental invasion
primary_outcome.description: By ultrasound, placental invasion in myometrium was given a stage

arm_group.description: This arm was given stage according to ultrasound features.

intervention.description: Pregnant women in 3rd trimester with anterior placenta previa and lower cesarean section scar. Ultrasound was done and according to parameters of the morbidly adherent placenta, a staging system was conducted.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Prior lower segment cesarean section
- Low lying anterior placenta
- Singleton pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical disorders
- vasa previa

reference.citation: Albayrak M, Ozdemir I, Koc O, Demiraran Y. Post-partum haemorrhage from the lower uterine segment secondary to placenta praevia/accreta: successful conservative management with Foley balloon tamponade. Aust N Z J Obstet Gynaecol. 2011 Aug;51(4):377-80. doi: 10.1111/j.1479-828X.2011.01309.x. Epub 2011 Apr 18.
American institute of ultrasound in medicine 2015.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate Professor in Obstetrics and Gynecology Department
